alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Franklin; Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 8:02AM EST until December 20 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... New Hampshire... Androscoggin River At Gorham affecting Coos and Oxford Counties. Androscoggin River Near Auburn affecting Cumberland, Androscoggin and Sagadahoc Counties. Androscoggin River At Rumford affecting Franklin, Androscoggin and Oxford Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Androscoggin River at Rumford. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.6 feet, This is a 100 year flood. In Mexico, flooding occurs on Riverside Avenue, Dix Avenue, Holman Avenue, Osgood Avenue, Carlton Avenue, and Flood Street. In Rumford, flooding occurs on Propect Avenue, Eaton Hill Road, Front Street, and Sunnyside Terrace. Hundreds of acres of farm fields also flood downstream in Dixfield and Canton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 21.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM EST Tuesday was 22.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 8.0 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.2 feet on 04/01/1987. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
